abstract: Costa Rica has directed local government and law enforcement officials to help protect mass nesting of olive ridley sea turtles on beach; increased security was prompted by selfie-taking tourists wandering through nesting areas, whose photos on social media cause international outrage; stricter rules are also put in place to govern tourists who wish to witness phenomenon.
lead_paragraph: Weeks after tourists disrupted the nesting of thousands of olive ridley sea turtles, the government said it would enforce stricter security measures.

headline.main: Costa Rica to Shield Sea Turtles
headline.print_headline: Costa Rica to Shield Sea Turtles

snippet: Weeks after tourists disrupted the nesting of thousands of olive ridley sea turtles, the government said it would enforce stricter security measures.
